meanings.definition: To move in a sharp, sudden turn or change in direction.
meanings.sent1: The car will zig to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent2: She likes to zig when she dances.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to zig instead of zag, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to zig through the valley, cutting a new path.
meanings.sent5: The kite zigged and zagged in the wind, soaring high above.

meanings.definition: A sharp, sudden turn or change in direction.
meanings.sent1: The runner made a quick zig to avoid the defender.
meanings.sent2: The mountain road had many zigs and zags.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful zigs and zags entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: The plot of the story took an unexpected zig towards the end.
meanings.sent5: The lightning took a zig before striking the ground.
